text.section: Every licensed taxidermist shall keep a suitable record for five (5) years in which shall be entered the species of each wildlife mounted by him and the name and address of the person for whom the mounting was done.
Any legally taken wildlife may be mounted, provided the wildlife bears identification with the name and address of the owner and date and place taken until such time as it is mounted.

A fish and wildlife disposal permit, signed by a conservation officer, must be attached to wildlife taken other than during a legally open hunting season. Such permit will substitute for the identification required in subsection (2) of this section.

law.history: Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 141, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1988. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 265, sec. 21, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 178, sec. 15, effective June 17, 1978. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 200, sec. 56, effective June 19, 1952. -- Created 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 18.
